item.description:
"Into the Woods" is a musical that intertwines the plots of several Brothers Grimm fairy tales and follows them further to explore the consequences of the characters' wishes and quests. The main characters are taken from the stories of Little Red Riding Hood, Jack and the Beanstalk, Rapunzel, and Cinderella, tied together by a story involving a baker and his wife and their quest to have a child. Everyone gets their wishes granted and lives happily ever after. . .or do they?

There are multiple performances:

Thursday, August 9, 8:00 PM
Friday, August 10, 8:00 PM
Saturday, August 11, 2:00 PM

http://web.mit.edu/gsp/www/Archive/2012summer_intothewoods/

Tix are $5-$15 depending on whether or not you're a student.

I'll be playing violin in the show; we can meet in the lobby afterwards to mingle. Â There is usually a reception on opening night.
item.name: MIT Gilbert & Sullivan Players Present: "Into the Woods"
